cheatsheet.title: Create a new User Defined Indicator

intro.description: This tutorial guides you through the creation of a user defined indicator.

item.title: Create the User Defined Indicator
item.description:
This step opens the "New Indicator" wizard. Right click on the folder "Libraries/Indicators/User Defined Indicators" and select the menu "New Indicator".
This wizard creates a User Defined Indicator.

item.title: Content of the User Defined Indicator
item.description: Please select the Language and input the SQL Template in the Wizard. These keywords can be use here: <%=__AND_WHERE_CLAUSE__%>, <%=__WHERE_CLAUSE__%>, <%=__TABLE_NAME__%>, <%=__TABLE_NAME_2__%>, <%=__COLUMN_NAMES__%>, <%=__GROUP_BY_ALIAS__%>, <%=__LIMIT_ROW__%>, <%=__PATTERN_EXPR__%>, <%=__JOIN_CLAUSE__%>, <%=__LIMIT_OFFSET__%>, <%=__LIMIT_ROW_PLUS_OFFSET__%>, <%=__COLUMN_NAME_A__%>, <%=__COLUMN_NAME_B__%>. When you complete the User Defined Indicator, the Editor will open, the default category of User Defined Indicator is "User Defined Count".
